titles.title: A bill to provide for the extension of the enforcement instruction on supervision requirements for outpatient therapeutic services in critical access and small rural hospitals through 2015.
A bill to provide for the extension of the enforcement instruction on supervision requirements for outpatient therapeutic services in critical access and small rural hospitals through 2015.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

calendar.text: Committee on Finance. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Finance. Reported by Senator Hatch with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 114-109.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 188.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Committee on Ways and Means discharged.
Committee on Energy and Commerce discharged.
Committee on Ways and Means discharged.
Mr. Burgess asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on July 30, 2015. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
(Sec. 1) This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to continue to instruct Medicare contractors not to enforce requirements for direct physician supervision of outpatient therapeutic services in critical access and small rural hospitals through 2015.
